Description: Part of a faience vessel. Yellow faience, with markings in purple; colours faded. Boy (?) to front, moving to right and carrying a lyre on left arm and plectrum in right hand; he is nude, with curly hair indicated by colour; on the right, remains of another figure. Very high relief, almost in the round.
Bibliographic references: Roman Pottery / Catalogue of the Roman Pottery in the British Museum (K11)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
